# Romer - Knowledge Economy
**ON ROMER - KNOWLEDGE ECONOMY** 

No Date

[https://americanaffairsjournal.org/2020/08/the-knowledge-economy-a-critique-of-the-dominant-view/](https://americanaffairsjournal.org/2020/08/the-knowledge-economy-a-critique-of-the-dominant-view/)

_Roberto Mangabeira Unger_

  

Platform Oligopolies 

_"Much of the appeal, and consequently of the economic value, of the platforms lies in the size, inclusiveness, or universality of their user base. As a consequence, antitrust law is an inadequate instrument for taming their abuses. Breaking these companies up would destroy a large part of their social value... The evolution of the knowledge economy, even in its present truncated form, demands an expanding practice of collab­oration—including collaboration among firms that remain competitors even as they also become partners. It makes increasing use of incomplete, relational contracts that leave crucial terms open and have a practice of shared innovation as their aim, rather than a discrete and momentary performance... Innovations in the regimes of governance and property hold more promise."_

  

Intellectual Property Law

_"The established law of intellectual property—much of it an inven­tion of the late nineteenth century—also favors the exclusive and long‑standing, albeit temporary, prerogative of a single right owner: the patent, copyright, or trademark holder. But the knowledge econ­omy needs a proliferation of alternative ways to reward innovation, without allowing the rewarded to impose exclusive control on their inventions and to charge unshared rents for their use."_

  

He later goes on to hypothesize that collaboration between these firms is the way to regulate the network multipliers of platform oligopolies, which sounds a lot like federated services. 

  

Romer was not necessarily wrong on the knowledge economy, but that the we should not equate the knowledge economy and software microeconomics, even if they share a lot of threads

# Hipster's DIlemma, Baulldriard
**HIPSTERS DILEMMA, Baulldriard**

I dont know how to phrase this, but my ('my" in the sense that I have been unable to find a sufficiently similar concept written about by scholars to attribute it to, but I understand it most likely exists) idea (idea in the sense that its a blurry, currently being formed, amorphous worldview hypothesis I am trying to sharpen) of the "hipsters dilemma" (an observation on the phenomena of the hipster who infinitely attempts to find what is "real" and "authentic" and "original" (usually at the expense of other hipsters, ("that movie is really derivative of this movie", "metal is just surf rock in the minor scale with distortion", etc) but who then really just stops the depth search arbitrarily (IE when they see archaic fonts at an upscale inner city barbecue restaurant)

  

is feeling eerily similar to Baulldriards / postmodernism's critical analysis of what is "real", in his sense that Disneyland is a copy without an original (distorted from many sources, argued by Baulld as potentially better than the real places its based on ("the food is better, and the service is better")).

  

Now your asking yourself and your knee that has jerked "why does this nonsense about what is "rEaL" and "nOt ReAL" matter

  

  

Hipsters don't like Disneyland because it is so derivative of the perceived "real" places it is based on ("its only a simulation"). I argue this is misguided given that the hipsters ideas of "authenticity" (equated by the hipster to goodness) are generally arbitrarily selected. 

  

For instance, a hipster says "I prefer real castles like Neuschwanstein Castle to the Disneyland Castle, you know, (then pulling out his trivia trump card) its what Walt based the Disneyland Castle on." The second hipster frowns. He then proposes "Neuschwanstein Castle was built in the 19th century as part of the Romanticism movement. Its not even a real castle. It's shit at defense vs medieval German castles. Like Eltz Castle." This set of interactions happens ad infinitum until youve debated the nature of "what is a castle" and ended up at proto germanic motte and bailey hill forts in the iron age at which point the two hipsters accept an arbitrary truth-ness floor

  

I feel in alignment with the sentiment that this may be the same phenomena that has been intensifying inside the art world, like we've before talked about, and other art-like professions like architecture. To gain credibility chops to the other hipsters that run the place, funding, professionally criticizing, and popularizing your art, this questioning into the very depths of \*"what is a thing, fundamentally"\*, \*\*when taken to the extreme\*\*, (potentially necessary given a modern global scale) leaves you with featureless, ornamentation-less, amorphous forms, like modern and postmodern buildings (and fine art), which attempt to distill down what the essence of what a thing is, and yet feel lifeless and removed of ornamental flavor.

# Modernism
**Modernism**

Modernism is the post-enlightenment idea that humanity can create a progressively better world via objective, formalized, science-like engineering, as well as in some cases, such as art, a rejection of the past as backward. The best way to tie this up is in the use of all encompassing meta-narratives, as best exemplified by Marx. 

  

I personally believe this is an attempt at the replacement of God derived truth with some other form of absolute truth.

  

I believe feminist and Marxists meta-narratives are to be viewed with suspicion despite that they may be correct.

  

"Science is not a belief its a set of rules" - to which I say, there is an underlying belief / assumption of axioms, such as, that truth exists for a given amount of convincing evidence. 

  

Law is roughly the science of ethical questions. Look at evidence, compare to previous historical decisions in "the literature". The difference between this and science may be the lack of experiment, as the "truth testing" happens iteratively. 

  

In the form of arts, this came in the form of many movement manifestos in the period, in the forms of Impressionism and Cubism. In the form of politics, this can in the form of similar -isms, such as socialism and fascism.

  

An area of study or speculation that masquerades as science in an attempt to claim a legitimacy that it would not otherwise be able to achieve is referred to as [pseudoscience](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pseudoscience), [fringe science](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fringe_science), or [junk science](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Junk_science).[\[9\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philosophy_of_science#cite_note-9) Physicist [Richard Feynman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Feynman) coined the term "[cargo cult science](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cargo_cult_science)" for cases in which researchers believe they are doing science because their activities have the outward appearance of it but actually lack the "kind of utter honesty" that allows their results to be rigorously evaluated.[\[10\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philosophy_of_science#cite_note-cargocultscience-10)

  

To truly attempt to find a scientific "meaning of life", one must only figure out what "the meaning of life" is not 

  

POSTMODERN - when the simulacrum becomes the object itself, such as the word becomes the thing in itself rather than the content of the word

Modernism turned god into simulacrum

# Connerian Manifesto - 2020
**2020 Connerian Manifesto** 

_NOTE: Any references to science is not to draw truth from science but rather to utilize the relationships as metaphors for understanding the complexity of life; just as the animists believed the universe was spirits, the renaissance believed life was a clockwork, and we now increasingly perceive life as a simulation._ 

  

KEY TAKEAWAYS: (D means difficult integrating) (From Manifesto 2018)

-   Protect your inputs - _Do not become a product of a seemingly inescapable environment_

-   You are the product of your actions and environment (which does not mean you are absolved of fault, you are always responsibility for levels of awareness and reaction thusly).

-   “You might not have noticed, but your brain did.”
-   Words are power
-   Everything matters
-   Life as Vectors, only having direction and magnitude. No privileged observer (rather than dimensions with positive and negative), AKA Moral Relativism
-   Perception is relative - _rewrite your past_
-   _“Men are disturbed not by events but by their opinion about events.” - Epictetus_ 
-   Life as a set of promises - If we keep making promises, we may never notice how many are broken
-   Other people do not matter until you matter to other people. (Love)
-   Kill your darlings - _You must constantly die to be constantly reborn._ 
-   Creation Myths are powerful, windows to the future
-   True self service many times involves empowering others
-   Assume Nothing, Probe Frequently - _communicate (receive and send) frequently, with truth probes every so often_
-   Practice taking care of something - _Life's progression: Raise a plant, raise a dog, raise a kid, raise your parents_
-   (D) Speaking something makes it lose its power - _don't blow your idealist load too early by announcing an under baked idea, just because you get a dopamine boost from conflating announcing and idea and achieving and idea_
-   (D) Obstacle as opportunity
-   (D) man must humble himself before he can refuse to be humbled 
-   (D) Collapse reality. Look into the void. Peer into the Box, do not let it stay as potential only.

-   Managed and tuned ignorance, chosen, self aware ignorance 
-   Time does not rest - _Indecision and inaction are the only thing that causes regrets_

-   (D) Your face and body is a tapestry of your good and bad health decisions (eat healthy and do cardio)
-   (D) Enjoy the process - _more than the result, because the result will always differ from vision (keep your expectation in check)_
-   (D) Associate with people you want to be. 
-   Parent to child emotional zero sum economics - _"If ya always got your way all the time, think about how many people wouldn't get theirs."_ (Life as zero sum?)
-   Elements of religion, such as sacrifice, positive worship of existence, admittance of guilt, anxiety assuagement via institutional truth, ritual, community 
-   You are not who you are. You are not who you were. You are not what you've become. You are what you are becoming.

  

_PERSONAL REFLECTIONS / ANXIETIES_ 

-   My father/family lacks a tradition of excellence, but excellent in brute force willpower (farm people thoughts)
-   I have unresolved anxiety of becoming a depressed, average, parent 
-   True Horror is very difficult to describe, but I think it may be the negative interpretation and tangible erosion of all elements of the perceived self, some sort of ego death?
-   Emotional exposure therapy, requires limited dosing and in safe environment

Rule Utilitarianism - Values

# Types of Utilitarianism
**TYPES OF UTILITARIANISM** 
Act Utilitarianism - Values based on results of actions
Rule Utilitarianism - Values based on rules

Motive Utilitarianism - Create Motives that Lead to actions wherein Maximum Potential Utility is Derived such that overall contentedness is maximized. Do actions which manifest in many common domains such that your skillset is specific and yet adaptive to yet unseen hidden variables and uses.

  

Two Level Utilitarianism (Act + Rule) = Intuition (Rule) and Critical Thought (Act) Life is sometimes too complex for a critical take on it, which is were rule utilitarianism, or intuition, comes in

  

Motive Utilitarianism states that our initial moral task is to inculcate motives within ourselves (by means of teaching and repetition) that will be generally useful across the spectrum of the actual situations we are likely to encounter, rather than hypothetical examples which are unlikely to occur. It can be thought of as a hybrid between Act and Rule Utilitarianism, but it also attempts to take into account how human beings actually function psychologically.

  

Two-Level Utilitarianism states that normally we should use "intuitive" moral thinking, in the form of Rule Utilitarianism, because it usually maximizes happiness. However, there are some times when we must ascend to a higher "critical" level of reflection in order to decide what to do, and must think as an Act Utilitarian would. This method is based on the view that, although Act Utilitarianism may be preferable in theory, usually it is too difficult to perfectly predict consequences, and so we require moral guidelines or rules in day to day life.

# Custom is King - Eating Our Fathers
**CUSTOM IS KING - EATING OUR FATHERS** 
#darius #culture
```
During his reign, [**Darius**](https://www.ancient.eu/darius/) summoned the Hellenes at his court and asked them how much money they would accept for eating the bodies of their dead fathers. They answered that they would not do that for any amount of money. Later Darius summoned some Indians called Kallatiai, who do eat their parents. \[...\], he \[Darius\] asked the Indians how much money they would accept to burn the bodies of their dead fathers. They responded with an outcry, ordering him to shut his mouth lest he offended the gods. Well, then, that is how people think, and so it seems to me that Pindar was right when he said in his poetry that custom is king of all (Herodotus 3.38.3-4).
```

# Aurelius
**Aurelius** 

Think about your life: childhood, boyhood, youth, old age. Every transformation, a kind of dying. Was that so terrible? Think about life with your grandfather, your mother, your adopted father. Realize how many other deaths, and transformations, and endings there have been, and ask yourself: was that so terrible? Then neither will the close of your life be - its ending and transformation.

  

At dawn when you have trouble getting out of bed, tell yourself, "I have to go to work, as a human being. What do I have to complain of, if I'm going to do what I was born for - the things I was brought into the world to do? Or is this what I was created for - to huddle under the sheets and stay warm?"

  

"It's unfortunate that this happened." No. It's fortunate that this has happened and I've remained unharmed by it - not shattered by the present or frightened of the future. It could have happened to anyone. But not everyone could've remained unharmed by it. (Marcus Aurelius, Meditations)

  

Choose not to be harmed, and you won't feel harmed. Don't feel harmed, and you haven't been. (Marcus Aurelius, Meditations)

  

Soon you'll be ashes, or bones. A mere name at most, and even that is just a sound, an echo. (Motivation to live.)

  

Then what should we work for? Only this: proper understanding, unselfish action, truthful speech. A resolve to accept whatever happens as necessary and familiar, flowing like water from that same source and spring. (Good life goals.)

  

“The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.”

  

“How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it.”

  

  

Seneca

Associate with people who are likely to improve you. Welcome those whom you are capable of improving. The process is a mutual one: men learn as they teach.

  

Self-contented as he is, then, he does need friends - and wants as many of them as possible - but not to enable him to lead a happy life. This he will have even without friends. The supreme ideal does not call for any external aids, it is homegrown and entirely self-developed. Once it starts looking outside itself for any part of itself, it is on the way to being dominated by Fortune. (Seneca, Letters from a Stoic)

# Philosophy of Science
**PHILOSOPHY OF SCIENCE**

[Imre Lakatos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imre_Lakatos) advanced a midway view between the "postmodernist" and "realist" camps. For Lakatos, scientific knowledge is progressive; however, it progresses not by a strict linear path where every new element builds upon and incorporates every other, but by an approach where a "core" of a "research program" is established by auxiliary theories which can themselves be falsified or replaced without compromising the core.

  

Recap from tonights reading on philosophy of science 

  

I still dont believe there is an objective reality. There is an effective objective reality, yes, the one we deal with on a daily basis, but I do not see how there can be an absolute one. I will briefly explain last. Things in between are disconnected reflections.  
  
1\. All science is based on foundational assumptions. Such a belief is backed up by modern approaches to philosophy of science. It also seems illogical to assume otherwise.

  
2\. I am highly skeptical that at universe scale and plank scale rules abide by human intuition, given what I gather we know about those scales.  
  
3\. It is the coherency of a system that determines its reality value, ala coherentism, and so I am not against science, as much as you may want to paint it that way.  
  
4\. I also agree with the structuralists. They argue reality exists as empirical scientifically abstracted objects connected by relations.  
  
In other words, reality is absolutely relational and contextual, a domain of functions and mathematical relations, punctuated and distinguished by empirical scientifically derived abstract bundles of properties, or objects. Again the point being tho that this is only an abstraction, and that the only thing that is truly "real" in the absolute sense are the relations themselves.  
  
It is in this way that a light particle is a bundle of properties. I am not saying light isn't "real." What I am saying is that the structuralist philosophy suggests that the fundamental unit of the universe is the relation rather than the object.  
  
How then can there then be an absolute reality if so much is dependent on relations influenced by reference frame?

# Descartes
**Descartes** 

Descarte arrives at his first principle through doubting everything until he finds things he can not doubt. This considers the idea that most things are based on previous notions. Descartes first doubts the senses, as they flawed in perception. Then Descartes doubts seemingly objective things such as mathematics, as they could be made to seem true by an external being, referred to as Descartes' Evil Demon, who influences our perceptions to believe things are true when they are not. 

Descartes then demonstrates that which to him is absolutely certain, cogito ergo sum, I think, therefore I am. He can not doubt the fact that he is thinking. Therefore, to Descartes, it is the primary thing which proves he exists.

# Searle Materialism and Functionalism
**Searle Materialism and Functionalism**

Reductive Empiricism - if empiricism is everything is based on the senses, then the soul can not exist because it is not directly sensed

Functionalist - we are machines that process information, that thinking is like computer programs

  

Searle - Response to Functionalism 

Distinction - management of abstract symbol manipulation 

//Simulation vs Duplication 

Searle believes that machines are syntactically arranged rather than semantics (actual understanding)

Chinese Room - Reductio ad absurdum - reduce to absurd

Man in a room with Chinese syntax, he doesn’t speak Chinese, but he was able to translate the Chinese syntactically 

  

Collective systems create understanding 

// current collective consciousnessess like corporation are low in consciousness because they take in lots of sensory data but do not process enough

  

Dualism – I am a body and a mind. 

Idealism – I am a conscious mind, or soul, or spirit. (body is a perception)

Materialism – I am my body. (the brain creates consciousness)

  

Behaviorism- purely empirical approach to understand consciousness in terms of what can be directly observed. Thus treating consciousness as behavior and tendencies to behave in response to certain stimuli.

Functionalism- consciousness is the result of functions that are performed by the Brain. The implication is that the functions could be performed in another context with the same result. Hence, artificial intelligence is possible.

  

Identity theory- Deals with mental events as identical to physical events in the brain. 

  

Ockham’s Razor - do not speculate entities until they are observed

  

  

  

Syntax- the order and arrangement of symbols in any language. 

Semantics- the meaning of the symbols or series of symbols in any language.

  

  

The Chinese room experiment is one in which a man with a book of Chinese syntax, given an some time, can decode a message in chinese given to him from outside of the room. However, the man in the room would not know what the Chinese message actually said or meant. This is _reducto ad absurdum_, reduction to absurdity, to express Searle's point that there is a difference between syntax, the arrangement of words, and semantics, the actual meaning of the words. Therefore, true artificial intelligence is impossible to Searle, because machines can never know the semantics of what they are doing, and only the syntax.

# Plato and Heraclitus
**PLATO and HERACLITUS** 

Heraclitus- The opposite of Parmenides in every way, he thought that all reality was characterized by constant change. Plato is influenced by his thought regarding the world that we experience. In particular, all truth is relative in his view. Plato finds this a compelling vision of a world without his unchanging forms. Heraclitus sees the changing world as all that there is. Plato sees it as requiring us to look for permanence and lasting truth outside the realm of the visible. 

  

Forms are something abstract that we as a society constantly argue about what comprises them as we approach, but never achieve, absolute truth. Language vocabulary itself could be considered a codification of a series of Forms. A tree is not a tree, it is something we have ascribed and agreed a set of qualities a tree has, to a reasonable resolution now such that we can greatly classify trees. We teach and agree what a tree is. 

  

When we don’t agree, however, there is a discourse, and I can not say whether it produces the “right” result, but whoever ideas are more powerful and resonant succeeds (their actions and ideas are linked and allowed them to say, amass military power). So while I agree that majority agreement on something is therefore what the majority believes is “good” and therefore is effectively, we can not trust that there is not a pyramidal influence on the majority. 

  

In this sense, I most agree with Heraclitus and Plato, that everything that is perceivable is relative, and things that are absolute are imperceivable, regardless of their existence. As for the immaterial realm, such as Plato’s discussion of a soul, as mentioned earlier, I believe it is useful. Concepts such as the Plato’s innate idea may just be a way for us to comprehend the deterministic nature of the universe and the influence of things that string far before our comprehension, like the influence culture has on one’s decision making. However, I do not believe they truly exist, beyond our own minds. However, on the subject of the innate idea, the very fact that animal studies show that animals know something essential to their own birth, such as the instinct to go towards light and swallow, such things could exist in the results of some permutation of DNA and scientifically be passed down. But things as complex as the example mentioned a tree, I am skeptical to believing our innate idea’s have such resolution until we name them or learn through experience.  
  
Mathematically, the human race is constantly approaching the infinity of absolute truth and forms, which we can never reach. Pragmatically the soul is a useful construct and can not be disproven to exist if it exists outside a perceivable realm. However, we are constantly stepping outside Plato-esque caves in an infinite series of caves, increasing our resolution of truth.  
  
As a note I don’t want to appear nihilistic I think it is a worthy pursuit. 

  

I also really like the Euthyphro example because it enlightened me into realizing how relative the appeal to the authority of the gods as influence in action, in his case to determine righteousness. Pleasing to the gods sounded reasonable to me at first, but then realizing, yes that is right, the gods of greeks did quarrel and do questionable moral things. In this sense is god the right term to be used in the modern age West with all the baggage that comes with the word god?

  

\---------------------------

A form in Plato's metaphysical theory is an ideal thing that is independent of our reality, they do not exist in it. A form is a perfect, abstract thing like Justice or Beauty or Goodness, that are not spatial or temporal, they are immaterial. Plato considers the Form the real object and the object we interact with in our reality a shadow of the Form.

# Hinduism Brahman Atman Maya
**HINDUISM BRAHMAN ATMAN MAYA**

The Atman is our true self, but not individuated from the totality. This totality is the Brahman, the everything, which is manifested as whole and part our Atman. 

  

The Maya is the illusion of separateness that we cling to in this world. It is the focus on the elements of life that we wish were permanent without regard for the fact they are impermanent. Vishnu asks a man to get him water, and on the way the man sees a woman. He marries her, has children, who then all get washed away by a flood. Vishnu appears to him and asks him if he understands the Maya. Shankara believes this is what hides the truth from us, that we are one with the totality that is the Brahman. That when we die and lose everything from the material world, we return to the totality. _If we do not realize this truth at death, we are reincarnated in relation to our karma._ 

  

\-----------------------------

**Shankara**

We are one, our conciseness are one, but things that differentiate us disguise and confuse this fact.

  

// Identity is diffuse 

// Diffused amongst the network of the self 

  

The teacher that is separate than the student he is not a teacher 

  

//you are reincarnated as your children

  

// Divinity is the ideal, and these concepts express themself in everything (in reality it is the other way around)

  

Are waves their own thing, or are they part of the sea?

  

In other words, devotion can be defined as the search for the reality of one’s own Atman. 

  

\------------------------------

The Atman is our true self. The Atman, however, is also one with the totality that is the Brahman, the Brahman being that of all being. The Five Coverings are the elements of the Maya that confuse, distract, and disguise us from perceiving our Atman, and therefore Brahman, and therefore from true being.

# Locke Vs Berkely
**Locke Vs Berkely** 

Locke is an empiricist that is a sort of counter to Descartes’s rationalism 

Descartes rationalism is that he doubts the senses and believes everything can be derived apriori

  

Locke believes everything is derived from the senses 

If a tree falls int he forest the molecules shake but there is no “sound” as we know the concept of sound 

Locke believes that an object has primary qualities that are independent of the observer, and there are secondary qualia that exist in relation to the perceiver 

Locke believes that people are tabula rasa or blank slates , rather than the platonic notion that there are innate ideas 

Simple ideas are the impression of concepts of taste and shape 

Complex ideas are the composition of ideas into a complex form, such as an apple, that contain things such as color, taste, shape dimension which additively create the concept of an apple

  

Berkeley Disagrees with Locke 

There are not be simple ideas that are independent of the perceivers understanding of its simple ideas

Perceptions are always connected to qualia

Berkely - To be perceived is to be known 

  

Berkely Theory of Knowldedge 

All knowledge come from these sources

ideas imprinted on the senses (perception)

Passions and operations of the mind (reason)

Ideas formed by memory and imagination (combination)

  

Berkeley’s metaphysics is called subjective idealism . His views constitute a va riety of idealism because he argued that r eality consists of finite or created minds, an infinite mind (God), and the ideas (thoughts, feelings, and sensations) these minds have.

  

ll of these things are immaterial. This idealism is termed subjective because physical objects do not exist apart from some subject (mind) who perceives them. This kind of idealism stands in contrast to objective idealism , which holds that al though r eality is mental, it does exist independently of the human knower because it is a manifestation of an absolute mind. Objective idealism is usually monistic (or at least nondualistic), maintaining that there is one absolute mind and the universe is a manifestation of it Berkeley’s subjective idealism, though nondualistic in the sense of asserting that all reality is mental or immaterial, is pluralistic in the sense that there are many finite minds independent of God’s mind.

  

Berkely 

Empiricism is the view that knowledge derives from sense experience and that knowledge claims are tested by reference to sense experience. If empiricism is true, then all we can know directly or immediately are the ideas or sensations that occur in our minds. 

  

Locke

Empiricism is the view that knowledge derives from sense experience and that knowledge claims are tested by reference to sense experience. If empiricism is true, then all we can know directly or immediately are the ideas or sensations that occur in our minds. 

Locke was dual, berkeley is monist

Berkeley would say he is a being perceiving and sensing and then 

  

Why is it an “abstraction” to say that an object of sense exists outside of its being perceived?

  

It is an abstraction because there would be no idea, no conception of it, and therefore cease to exist in our minds and therefore cease to exist

  

What, according to Berkeley, can we know besides our ideas and minds?

God, 

  

How might reality remain constant when no person perceives it?

Reality is maintained constant by god 

  

According to Berkeley, an object can not be known to exist independent of it's being perceived because Berkeley believes that the object itself is defined by the sensory perception of that object. Specifically, he counters Locke's argument that there are simple qualities removed from our sensory perception because this is an abstraction, as the ideas of those simple qualities could not exist outside ideas, which are derived from perception.

**Colt** 
#history #colt #ar15 #m4
In October 2009, Army weapons officials proposed a series of changes to the M4 to Congress. Requested changes included an electronic round counter that records the number of shots fired, a heavier barrel, and possibly replacing the [Stoner expanding gas](https://patents.google.com/patent/US2951424A/en) system with a [gas piston](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gas-operated_reloading#Short-stroke_piston) system.

 The M4 designation itself comes from the U.S. military designation system, whose terms are in the [public domain](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_domain).\[57\]

# Fungi and the Carboniferous
      

**Fungi and the Carboniferous** 

  

During the Carboniferous, animals and bacteria had great difficulty with processing the [lignin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lignin) and [cellulose](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cellulose) that made up the gigantic trees of the period. Microbes had not evolved that could process them. The trees, after they died, simply piled up on the ground, occasionally becoming part of long-running wildfires after a lightning strike, with others very slowly degrading into [coal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coal). [White rot fungus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wood-decay_fungus) were the first living creatures to be able to process these and break them down in any reasonable quantity and timescale. Thus, fungi helped end the Carboniferous period, stopping the endless pile-up of dead trees in Earth's forests of the era and breaking trees open to release their carbon back into the atmosphere.[\[31\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carboniferous#cite_note-FOOTNOTEKrulwich2016-31)

# Fujiyama Mamma - Song by Wanda Jackson
      

**Fujiyama Mamma - Wanda Jackson**
#music #japan
  

Some have questioned how an American song that explicitly referenced the dropping of atomic bombs on Japan could have become a major pop hit in Japan.[\[1\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fujiyama_Mama#cite_note-Hidden-1) One author attributes the success of the song in Japan to its embodiment of the desire for female empowerment in post-war Japan.[\[2\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fujiyama_Mama#cite_note-Keaveney-2) Another author cited the song's provocative sexuality and even suggested that Jackson, a white singer, was engaged in "appropriation of the sexual allure of an oriental woman."[\[19\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fujiyama_Mama#cite_note-19)

[htt
items.full_text:
---
created: 2021-03-27T17:20
updated: 2024-09-16T20:02
---
# SF Black Fillmore Urban Renewal
      

**SF Black Fillmore Urban Renewal** 
#san-francisco #fillmore #urban #urban-renewal #history

[https://48hills.org/2017/02/racism-politics-redevelopment/](https://48hills.org/2017/02/racism-politics-redevelopment/)

  

Bad history — even when well-intended — gives me a headache, because it so often misses and conceals far more important truths. To wit, in a recent column David Talbot neatly summed up the conventional-wisdom Legend of “Negro Removal” driven by the city’s Redevelopment Agency decades ago:

_“Now that Iris Canada has joined the thousands of other African Americans who’ve been banished from the city, the mayor can put up a statue in honor of the centenarian. Maybe it can be erected in Justin Herman Plaza, named in celebration of the redevelopment czar who evacuated San Francisco’s black population in the 1960s.” (San Francisco Chronicle, February 13, 2017)._

**Uh, no.** In 1950 San Francisco’s African-American population was 44,000. it grew to 74,000 by 1960, 96,000 by 1970 – its all-time peak after redevelopment demolition was mostly finished – and then back to 86,000 in 1980. Plainly, there was not an “evacuation” while Justin Herman was alive (he died in 1971) or soon after. The long-term citywide decline in the city’s African-American population since 1980 is a result of different realities, another story, but not this one.

# Hot Water Plumbing
**House Hot water plumbing** 

-   Heat recovery from shower drain lines
-   "Priming" either manual or automatic such that hot water line is primed before actually turning on the water (waste)
-   R4 insulation on hot water pipes
-   Small volume twig lines
-   Dedicated return line for hot water
-   Plan as close to possible of having water sources within 1 cup of the water heater
-   All showers, faucets, washing machines, along central axis 
-   Recirc - system has thermostatic valve 
-   Farthest fixture should have a heat drop of around 5-10 degrees (assuming roughly 135 degree water)

SOLAR WATER HEATING

-   evacuated tubes?

  

Hyrdonics - house heating via water => not interested 

  

What is a heat pump water heater?

  

Gary Klein

PEX manifold requires lots of piping and wastes water 

Trunk and branch requires more piping, more pumps if pumps added

Best is single line, with small branches, single pump, recirculating, 

  

Remember to use as wide a radius a bend as possible, a 90 degree angle of pipe is equivalent to much more straight pipe
![[Comparing Efficiency in Three Hot-Water System Designs.png]]

items.full_text:
# Failed R&D of Bradley / Abrams Anti Air Platform

Failed R&D of Bradley / Abrams Anti Air Platform
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M247_Sergeant_York

In February 1982 the prototype was demonstrated for a group of US and British officers at Fort Bliss, along with members of Congress and other VIPs. When the computer was activated, it immediately started aiming the guns at the review stands, causing several minor injuries as members of the group jumped for cover. Technicians worked on the problem, and the system was restarted. This time it started shooting toward the target, but fired into the ground 300 metres (980 ft) in front of the tank. In spite of several attempts to get it working properly, the vehicle never successfully engaged the sample targets. A Ford manager claimed that the problems were due to the vehicle being washed for the demonstration and fouling the electronics.[18]In a report on the test, Easterbrook jokingly wondered if it ever rained in central Europe.[15]

- what is the estimated average and maximum ram, cpu, and gpu usage per webapp / website, and how does this form strategic decisions about the degree to run compute on local consumer hardware vs cloud (IE pricing model of consumer willingness to pay subscription vs willingness to spend on new hardware) (// I feel like consumers are being primed to no longer want to pay for better hardware (IE, they are primed to upgrade at a given expected lifecycle (4-5 years for laptop, 2-3 for phone) and just pay for subscriptions, unless you have dreams of being a prosumer (even then tho… not really as content creation has truly been democratized))
	- -> is there a future method to dynamically scale based on user hardware the amount of local and remote compute? 
	- Apple is the only manufacturer that is in the hardware business, and minimal cloud profit, and thus the only one incentivized to make this -> (they would never since creating such a service would prioritize low end systems which they don't profit on) -> this may suggest they would support local compute for prosumer AI, though it feels prosumer is a rapidly shrinking group. 
	- A desktop / laptop generally has cheap networking costs (data / power) and thus is a contender for cloud compute priority 
	- Meta has always been a data company, and now has years of experience with successful interface wearables. They would be incentivized to 

FUTURE 
- Shrinking Prosumer Market
- Less Need for Local Data Processing and Storage 
- Thin Client AI Wearables Subsidized by Data Sales
- Same cycles of device upgrades, while consumers also are accustomed to paying micro-subscriptions
- Apple changes CEO, moves forward with ai/cloud/social as it remains a niche luxury aspirational product associated with creatives. Gets in bed with Adobe, Figma. 
- Slowing of Moores Law but increases in energy density leads to** greater cloud compute but lower networking costs,** centralization of data power 

- Local AI -> Subscription Driven Thin Client, Phone as Compute Device and Networking Battery 
	- Embedded Wearable Models 
		- Fast: Wake word sensing 
		- Fast: Data collection
	- Phone / Desktop -> Startups can skip doing any compute here, only matters at scale
		- Medium: Multimedia data 'compression' before sending to cloud
		- Medium: Pro user large multimedia local data processing 
- Cloud AI -> Easier to scale and develop for.
	- Medium: Textual Prompt analysis, one shot multimedia analysis 
	- Slow: compressed multimedia data storage, async analysis

Google People would constantly highlight blank areas on your photos like there was a person there and say "Someone you know?"

That’s another weird thing I’d forgotten, they didn’t call it your “profile” they called it your “person”

items.full_text:
# This led to self-reliance, institution-building, and a culture of…

This led to **self-reliance**, institution-building, and a culture of land ownership (vs. peonage or plantation hierarchies).

* **Tax unproductive capital flows**: e.g., buybacks, speculative real estate, shell companies.
* **Reward patient capital**: long-term investments in infrastructure, R&D, and real businesses.
* **Public venture funds**: government co-investment in deep tech and supply chains, à la DARPA or EU’s IPCEIs.

**Track and publish real indicators**: supply chain depth, domestic sourcing %, energy independence, job multipliers. -> refund federal statistics agencies 

**Update antitrust**: break up service monopolies that extract but don’t build (e.g., ad tech, app stores).

**Reform patent/IP law**: discourage trolling and rent-seeking; encourage actual product development.

items.full_text:
# IMAGINED FUTURES
May 21 2025
- Eye Tracking 
- Always Recording AI / Retrievable Behavior 
- Embodied AI Robots 
	- Humanoid -> Nothing, pretty irrelevant if you have immigrants. 
	- Flying -> Regulation will be laxed to empower industrial development for wartime. 
	- Cars -> New Land Development Opporuntitie  for Upper Middle Class 
	- Specialized -> Manufacturing, Logistics 
	- Arms / Small Industrial -> Dangerous for Home Use, will be small industrial shops 
	- Hybrids
- Wearable AI 
- Retail Micro Industrial Shops <- seems too good to be true 
- Semi-Decentralized Industry
- China US War 
- More Ocean Exploitation -> For Wartime Development 
- Developed Nation Population Collapse 
- Nuclear Energy / Renewables -> For AI / energy needs -> // Decentralized SMRs nuclear makes sense if reactor fallout is minimal. 
- Further Democratization of Creativity via Image / Video Generation
- More Spam -> Less Trust of Algorithm (Depends when Digital Identity Happens) -> More trust of influencers / Meaning Makers -> Creative Professions will become even more demanding 
- Human Interaction becomes a Premium Experience -> Uber, Food, Transit, Education, Social, Vacation, Hobby 
- Social Trust Networks
- Asset Ownership will increase but effective political value will decrease during dilution and supply increase IE the new front lawn is a trust / 401k (LARP trust)
- // Class does not change but giving people last generations wealth symbols is sufficient to feel they are progressing -> propaganda should focus on making easily reproducible, easily scalable, or artificially constrained luxuries (high margin) accessible. IE Housing is not longer easily scalable due to political context, plateauing transit innovation commute lengths, hitting cultural/political density limits  
- AR ie Spatial Internet will take off for kids possibly, but my generation will not adopt it. 
- Further degradation of physical social institutions except in premium locations where social institutions become commercialized 
- // Human labor will not decrease because human labor will become more valuable in emotional roles. 
- Government will step in to maintain tax base in post labor economy -> so will support unionization / labor development in so far as it creates dependent consumers who have no choice but to pay taxes / rents // the government is rent seeking -> its economic incentive is to grow political power and increase taxes -> // Authoritarian Governments must love airplane travel

items.full_text:
# AI BUBBLE BURST (MAYBE)

AI BUBBLE BURST (MAYBE)
Aug 23 2025

My issue is people who think AGI is on the horizon. The valuations have that baked in. Clearly not.
However systems which integrate multiple domain specific models agentically, distributing the compute, could potentially be extremely powerful. 

The question is not "AI firms have zero profit". The question is what level the Gartner curve will it stabilze at after a similar dot com boom.

Additionally, I dont see a level of absurdity that the dot com boom had. Like Pets.com. Or Nuts.com. 

In fact given the interest rates I actually think we have less absurdity than the kickstarter low interest rate era pre-pandemic. The AI startups im seeing out here are of the same ilk of late - B2B SAS - inherently less risky, solving clear business problems. Not moonshots or make products for a blue ocean consumer.

So while there may be a mass panic 'bubble burst' - I think thats because of the public's inflated perception of big letters A and I - rather than the lack of potential profitability or lack of practical applications of the startups in the AI space.

items.full_text:
# A Thinly Veiled Insult

A Thinly Veiled Insult 
Napoleon and the Pope
Aug 15 2025

Thinly veiled insult At his coronation, Napoleon promised to send the Pope an altar, two ornate ceremonial coaches, and a tiara. Only the tiara was delivered.[4] Tiaras traditionally weighed between 2 and 5 pounds (0.91 and 2.27 kg). The Napoleon Tiara, however, weighed 18 pounds (8.2 kg). It was also too small to fit comfortably on a human head. Some of the jewels and decoration for this tiara came from earlier tiaras smashed and stolen by the troops of the French Directory in 1798, when General Louis-Alexandre Berthier invaded Rome, established the Roman Republic, abolished the Papal States, and exiled Pope Pius VI. His successor, Pope Pius VII, elected in exile in Venice, had to use an improvised papier-mâché tiara for his coronation in 1800. The tiara was a thinly veiled insult to the Pope.[5] However, the Pope thanked the emperor for the tiara by letter on June 23, 1805. He said that he intended to use the tiara for the Papal Mass on the Feast of Saints Peter and Paul.[1]

items.full_text:
# FIBERGLASS WEAPON
War is Boring - April 2, 2016 - Jospeh Trevithick

American fighter bombers fly over across South Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia dropping bombs filled with tiny fiberglass shards.
A few hours later, Viet Cong insurgents — and anyone else unfortunate enough to move into the contaminated areas — begin to develop maddening itches and painful sores. Some go blind from glass in their eyes.
This was the horrifying plan researchers at defense contractor HRB Singer developed for the Office of Naval Research in 1967. Part of a larger program nicknamed Project Poorboy during the Vietnam War, the Pentagon funded research into methods for stopping insurgents from moving down the Ho Chi Minh Trail.

“The technique and substance recommended are not absolute,” the scientists explained in a **1968 review** of the project. “[But] they do provide a means of identifying trespassers, of causing irritation and incapacitation as time progresses without engendering cries of bacteriological or chemical warfare.”
Still, the new weapon would present its own appalling, indiscriminate and potentially deadly effects. Thankfully, the Navy never acted on the proposal.

The HRB Singer scientists were explicit in their descriptions of how the fiberglass weapon might work. The small shards would settle in treetops, plants or lie in wait on the ground. Light enough to be carried on the wind, insurgents would have kicked up the material as they passed through the jungle.
“The fibers pervade the extremities, clothing, eyes, and food of the infiltrator as he passes through the area,” the scientists wrote in their proposal. “The infiltrator is not immediately aware of this pervasion but within a few minutes, when any activity is involved, he is physically irritated.”
“There are no effective countermeasures to this procedure,” the HRB Singer team added, predicting truly shocking results. Itchy, pus-filled sores would spring up on any exposed part of the body, especially the feet, within hours.
Before hitting their victims, the fibers could easily become covered with bacteria or other pollutants. Fighters could be blinded after getting the spun glass in their eyes. Scratching would only drive the splinters deeper into the skin.
Guerrillas could inhale the “fiber floss” or inadvertently eat unsealed food covered with fragments. Once inside the body, the tiny bits of glass could cause ulcers or tiny cuts on the throat, stomach and intestines.
It’d be useless to try and pluck the glass out of clothing. Difficult to remove from the skin, the fibers would probably have been impossible to remove from areas inside the body without surgery.
“Fibers which penetrate a person’s skin can be removed only by a tweezer and magnifying glass or by waiting until the penetrated area becomes infected and the splinter is forced out by the infection,” the report noted.

The idea behind the fiberglass bombs developed out of desperation. By 1968, the U.S. Navy and Air Force had already tried blowing up the Viet Cong’s jungle pathways with regular bombs and using large, air-dropped mines to halt cargo trucks, but with little success.

In search for a solution, the Pentagon looked at more exotic options like artificially increasing rainfall, **dumping chemicals** to gum up dirt roads and building **an electronic fence** that would warn American jets of guerrilla activity. The Air Force and the U.S. Army both tried dropping **huge tear gas bombs** to make specific zones uninhabitable. Navy scientists considered using nonlethal bacteria or **glowing chemicals** to mark individuals passing through insurgent-controlled territory.
But as the HRB Singer team explained, these compounds might cause an international incident no matter how safe they might be in the end. Despite mixed results in combat, tear gas proved to be a focal point for criticism both in the United States and abroad.
“Most remarks have been highly critical and give the impression that these munitions have had wides

items.full_text:
# Thief of Joy
Sep 20 2025
I realize comparison is the thief of joy 

Ala deus ex humans may want to be judged

But I think you should be very careful by whom you let yourself be judged. 

May be the case of god?

I was feeling pretty bad having hung out with the Nathan group who we don’t share a lot in common with, which leads to judgmental feelings about the boringness of these people.

Then I started watching architecture videos on IG and I felt connected again. The focus by Gaudi and Le Corbusier on light and heat, Studio North’s focus on local vernacular 

Also seeing Swati had liked that page got me hyped.

I gotta get off my ass and do the things I love 

Or I will never find people who love them too.

items.full_text:
# NEXT WEB 
MCP UI Reflections

Sep 11 2025 

Basically you have data providers like NYT or Creators or any websites, and you have LLM interfaces. 

If you realize the llm is like a new version of a browser and search combined, you basically are creating a new world of dynamic apps which have control over the style of their data being presented but allow the client to more broadly shape how they want it to be output lengthwise. 

Imagine a world where journalists have an agent which can output in their tone. Behind that is an MCP server with the underlying information of a new story and an MCP UI server of how they want it to be displayed. In that way you can also pay for NYT via tokens, rather than ads. 

Your personal LLM interface connects to that and renders out.
 

Could we see a world where NYT has an agent that writes in the journalist's voice, has access to underlying story data, and some MCP UI elements of how they things shown (like typography, charts, etc). Then, in your personal LLM interface, you ask it a question, it connects to the NYT agent, which charges per token, it loads a dynamically sized frame (either full webpage size or inside the chat size). So not just limited to a chat window.

	- ✅✅ Ji (Bachata, SF Zine Fest)
	- ✅✅ Matt (?, Tiat Playgrounds)

This was a long ass month. I feel my life degrading tho. This commuting is killing both my work output, therefore my respect, therefore my self perception. Additionally it is cutting out my personal life which used to impress people (probably long hair does not help). Good socialization this month, but below where it used to be. Sleep was also OK, but could easily be improved. Ji was gone, and yet, I found no matches online. What happened to me? Women in real life seem gravitated towards me (some, not the ones I want though). I realized this month how hard the search problem is, and you really need to organize (Be a Macher) people, build in your social leverage, and build social capital by doing things that matter to you. Also at work, I feel people perceive me as lazy - they have no idea about this commute.

items.full_text:
# Influencers 
Oct 21 2025
Social Capital 

We want to believe that we will be happy when people love us. When they all love us. Maybe then we will love ourselves. 

It stands to reason then, that this generation is the one that loves itself the least. Raised in a world shaking, pointing fingers at itself on the boiling pot of its own demise. The internet made them aware, and it made them old. The knowledge of jade in the eyes of old men, trapped in the soul yearning for stories of a past’s distorted future. 

Where then does this go. From tales of dignity of the every man, moral chocolate boxes in every end, instead we we’ve the mythologized fairy tales into the real, of surveillance, tv, reels, copies of copies, portholes into NEW Reality. Reels that drape themselves in the grassroots of the latest meme but reek of intention, selection. Buy this gun. Buy this game. Buy this class. Buy this travel. Buy this ticket. Buy this sub. Then you will be sufficed you will be entertained you will be safe you will be alone you will be together you will be at peace you will be loved you will be with me you will be free then you will finally exist. 

I regret to be and disdain the old man, shouting at cloud for what can never turn back. I do not yearn because this is not pivotal, it does not sound. For I can only see war in our future, the war of our eyes of our time. The war for our skin was won long ago, and we were too brittle a men to resist. 

*Dark is my night, oh carrion flies. Swarming above the carcass. *

I feel myself slipping. The path paved to the bottom of the tier list dot com is amorphous as it is painless, until one day you realize who you have become, fat, wicked, and restless. 

=============================================

There is only one way forward. Creative destruction. In the labs libertarians with Asian wives and haiiwain shirts in Silicon Valley built a reality in bits which transposed itself onto the real. If we could simulate X, if we could replicate X, if we could LARP X, why couldn’t we just BE X?

Future scenarios. 
- subtle propaganda guised in the regalia of the latest meme. I swear I saw a Sora Branded meme that was comically about a horse yelling at a guy not to buy one cigarette brand over another. Yet it had way more shots and 3D elements than any SORA video I have seen. Could this have been stealth cigarette advertisements? If you are only seeing a few ads the content is an ad. The medium is the message. 
- Betray the poor. 
- I think I might be done with media. But also not? I yearn to be propagandized into wanting what everyone wants. And yet I detest the idea of it. I detest being like everyone else. And yet I crave it more than anything. To feel other people understand my motives, my desires. 

BAS is about motion, repetitive motion. Reproduction, sex, growth. Life. And the transposition of the inverse. Stone. The effigy of life scrawled into the barren material in the universe. It is about stillness of stone and the lack of stillness we can never achieve amongst the hyper real. It's about the imposition of life on rock. Of feelings onto semiconductors. 

**Run Club** is a high relief sculpture based on a time series video of run clubs throughout San Francisco. Shot on a hyper telephoto lens, compressing depth nearly completely. Then, using an ai model trained on images to re add depth back into the photo, and then cast in stone. 

The run club is self aware, it knows what it is, and now has been filled with the same stench of club promoters. We have the keys to sex, they say behind digital bouncer doors, should you only come and find out. It is a place of relaxation, euphoria, mission, task, purpose, ritual, social maneuvering towards that real goal. 

**Youtube** is a medium in which no one can speak of the fact that the medium itself is the problem. It's like speaking around the issue. The elephant in the room that no one will address, the taboo, the fish that can't see water. Its about the

Newel of Knowledge

- Discomfort Journal - note down whenever you actively avoid doing something
- Listen for “Whispers” Jennifer Windt - https://psyche.co/ideas/personal-transformation-can-start-with-a-whisper-not-a-bang

- Small friction earlier stops big later - smallest possible version of the right thing
- You can not think your way back up the slope - “Mood Follows Action”
- Hormozi 3 Step Good Day Recipe 
	- Make positive contribution to a project you care about or that people you care about car about
	- Train hard / train at all 
	- Clean living space 
	- Good sleep
- // why is scrolling not as spiritually fulfilling as a good movie?
- Stop while its good - Hemingway 
- Real progress is shortening the gap / increasing durable tools for shortening the gap between fall and rise. 
- Goal Garden - Draw a flower each time you do something good. 

OPEN LOOPS
- Attack the scariest open loop first. Sleep will come with closed loops. Stop opening new loops, or commit to closing other loops. 

CONGRUENCE
- Help people solve their problems / needs
- Person your talking to yawns -> “It seems like” “your tired” rather than defensiveness 
- Girlfriend says she doesn’t have to pee on road trip, but continues to wiggle -> pull off, go to the bathroom yourself and invite her along. 
- I am -> I am becoming “Soren Kierkegaard”
- Don’t force people to be something they are not and especially don’t be mad at it

- ![SLIP DETECTOR - OPEN LOOPS](images/SLIP%20DETECTOR%20-%20OPEN%20LOOPS.png)

How to make bad habits less attractive?

items.full_text:
# INSURANCE CLAIM 

While backing out of narrow residential garage with less than 1” of clearance between my mirror and door frame, where exit opens directly onto blind downhill corner with frequent pedestrian, bicycle, skateboard, delivery moped, and vehicle traffic, requiring cautious maneuvering. Inside garage, adjacent vehicle was parked with over 12” of space on its wall side, leaving minimal room to enter or exit my car. 2nd vehicle, the subject vehicle, was parked in driveway on that same side of garage median, leaving about 42” of open driveway space on its far side, reducing clearance for exit. Garbage cans etc also present near the driveway that day. Additionally, cars park parallel in the rear, requiring a multi-point reverse turn with obstacles in four directions to exit when subject car is in the driveway. Due to the limited visibility, multiple obstructions, and the need for a multi-point turn to safely back out, minor contact occurred with other vehicle, resulting in surface scratching and no denting.

=====================================

Backing out of small garage, sub 1” clearance between mirror and garage door frame. Blind concrete wall corner which routinely has pedestrians walking fast downhill. Second car parked inside garage (with 12”+ clearance from their wall - whereas I barely can get out of my car with door partially open when parking - IE I provide them ample space from median of garage). 

Additional (and subject) car in driveway, on their side of median, but with 42 inches of clearance on far side (could have parked farther). Visible obstacles like garbage cans. Additionally, car parallel parked perpendicular in rear, requiring multi point turn with 4+ nearby obstacle-directions to pull out when subject car is in driveway. 

Their car was scratched with no dents.

items.full_text:
# McLean INVENTS CONTAINERS 
Nov 2 2025 

During the early 1950s, McLean decided to use the containers for general commercial goods. 

McLean secured a bank loan for $22 million and, in January 1956, bought two World War II T-2 tanker ships, which he converted to carry containers on and under deck. 

As the *Ideal-X* left the Port of Newark, Freddy Fields, a major official of the International Longshoremen's Association, was asked what he thought of the newly fitted container ship. Fields replied, "I'd like to sink that son of a bitch".[9] 

In 1967, Sea-Land was invited by the U.S. government to start a container service to South Vietnam. The service to Vietnam produced 40% of the company's revenue in 1968/69.[11]

Malcom revolutionized the maritime industry in the 20th century. His idea for modernizing the loading and unloading of ships, which was previously conducted in much the same way the ancient Phoenicians did 3,000 years ago, has resulted in much safer and less-expensive transport of goods, faster delivery, and better service. We owe so much to a man of vision, "the father of containerization," Malcolm P. McLean.[19]

items.full_text:
# Bas IDEAS
Nov 11 2025 

*WHEN YOU DON'T KNOW WHERE YOUR GOING ANY ROAD CAN GET YOU THERE. - Ross Scott*

Run Club 
- Hyperoptimization - comparison the thief of joy - being metricized and sharing it - running is hard to communicate the intermediate effort of - I feel most people these day underestimate effort more than before 
- Ownership by Corporate Overlord - no matter what apps tried to challenge it, Strava Won Out 
- Gross Club Promoter Mentality 
- Search For Reproductive Options 

I Own A Gun 
- "The glock was the first point and click interface" - Dave, Tactical Hive, Army Ranger 
 

- Coming out as a conservative 
- *"And boys being boys, they couldn't help but think something they were given, was something they had earned."* - Shane Carruth, 'A Topiary' 
 

- Vanguard Resentment
- Balancing Patriotism and Respect with Anti-War
- Modern Fascism Arising Within Oneself 
	- apocalyptic accelerationism (“let it collapse so we can restart”) -> The desire for rebirth 
	-  Fin De Seicle - The Desire For Regeneration, Degeneracy, Decadence, and Clues to the rise of Nationalist Authoritarianism in the 21st Century 
- Why Urbanists and Designers Tend Towards Authoritarianism - The Lie of Aesthetics 
- Adoption of Conservative Fashion 
- **Tinkuy**

Tinkuy is a Quechua word that means a meeting of opposing forces that complement each other. A meeting of opposites and differences. A meeting point where different thoughts, interests, feelings and aspirations confront and converge, providing the resurgence of new ways of thinking and that are embodied in confrontational actions, in mobilizations that seek change.
- Tinkuy - **Tinkuy** is a **Quechua** word often translated to mean “meeting,” “encounter,” or “coming together.” It appears in various cultural contexts throughout the Andes, especially in Peru. One of the most notable uses is in reference to gatherings or festivals that bring people together to celebrate and share cultural traditions—particularly weaving and textile arts.

![Bas IDEAS](images/Bas%20IDEAS.png)

Machine Spirits 
- Post Collapse in a world in which machine spirits live in all technology - animistic technology use
- Lares - Household Deities  
- Machine Spirits - Every piece of technology imbued with world understanding, self understanding, and the ability to share internal state -  such that it can readapt to changing conditions - a gun which auto updates its code protocols when connecting to newer systems.
- Breathing expanding *xirang *ground, the living earth, from Yu The Engineer 
- At a certain point in the Mayan collapse, monuments were written in character gobbledeegook, as writing was still prized, but there was no one there to read it 
 
- "The Letters Protect Our People From Vanishing " - Old Africa Script Proverb

# Automata In Greece
- Odyssey Bronze Man filled with god blood called Ichor 
- Mercury powered automata, since they thought mercury was a “living substance”
- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ichor

- Ichor was sacred blood of gods, given to automata 
- “Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.” - Arthur C Clarke, “Clarke's Law” “Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable **from nature**.” -Karl Schroeder 
 
- "Men destroyed those cities, but time took their names." -Byzantine Emperor Manuel II 
 

Content / Medium Is Message 
- Matty Healy of the 1975: The notification bar as a flattening of human experience between close relations and distant relations. 
 

Doorways 
- virtual doorways can affect memory, a phenomenon known as the "doorway effect" or "location updating effect". This effect happens because the brain interprets a doorway as an "event boundary," separating one set of memories from the next, making it harder to recall information from the previous room. The effect has been shown to occur in both virtual and real-world environments and is more likely when people are mentally overloaded.  
- Roman Gate that is metaphorically open

items.full_text:
# Feelings 
Nov 17 2025

Why do I feel like such a loser today? 
Is it because I went to the gym and felt great and productive yesterday and this is the dopa bounce?
Is it because I released Dingo Trak to very little fanfare on IG?
Is it the rainy weather? Is it the empty office?
Is it the lonely 1.5 hour one way commute?
Is it the Ji who I thought was interested in design now trying to work at a restaurant reveal? 
Is it because I have almost no social life now due to the commute?
Is it because it feels like our team at work is imploding, since many people are leaving / getting sidelined budget wise? 
Is it the middling response when we show people the bas casting mold?
Is it Michael our friend who lives in florida and mad I dont play online games iwth him, I haven’t seen physically in year but chat with on discord not engaging with my intellectual spiel and being visibly mad in chat from my response?
Is i the fact that at work Im working on coding a functional protoype for somethign that could just be achieved with wizard of oz and figma clickthroughs? where my two team mates are design and ux research and so cant really appreciate the effort it takes to code something? Thankless. Im spening engineering time building a slideshow with the abillity to play videos and audio. why?
Is it the lack of sunlight? 
Is it that I felt hollow and empty after hanging out with Bryce and Ricky? Ricky doesn’t really listen (has spent time with people who are worth listening to) and Bryce is just operating on a very shallow level and it’s becoming very obvious. 

*Am I focussed on the wrong things? *

““I arrived in reality, and almost no one was here.””

Communities of *doing* dissolved into audiences of *watching*.

items.full_text:
# TAIWAN 2026
Taipei, Mazu Pilgrimage 
Sep 13 2025 

Usually March 13
Taipei and Daija Mazu Pilgrimage 
- Day 1 - Taipei
- Day 2 - HSR to Taichung - Departure Ceremony at Jenn Lann Temple Night
- Day 3 - Walk the Pilgrimage 
-  Day 4 - Chiayi Arrival 
- Day 5 - **Jiufen & Shifen** (old mining towns, lanterns, mountain views)

Pingxi / Shifen

**Jiufen & Jinguashi (九份 / 金瓜石)**

* Steep mountain town with red lanterns, teahouses, and gold-mining history.
* Misty mountain views + Japanese colonial relics + temples built into the slopes.

* **Jiufen / Jinguashi** – easy day trip from Taipei; historic gold-mining town + mountain/sea views.
* **Wulai** – half-day trip from Taipei; indigenous Atayal culture + hot springs + river valley.
* **Tamsui** – short MRT ride from Taipei; riverside sunsets, forts, temples.

**## 
**
**## Central Taiwan (Taichung area)**
* **Lukang (鹿港)** – historic port town with temples and alleys; about 1 hr from Taichung.
* **Dasyueshan (大雪山)** – forest recreation area; natural side trip if you want hiking/fishing near Taichung.

**## Chiayi Region (Xingang arrival)**
* **Alishan (阿里山)** – mountain forests, sunrise railway, indigenous Tsou heritage. About 2 hrs from Chiayi City.
* **Chiayi City** – small but historic; Hinoki Village (Japanese forestry housing), Alishan Railway HQ, temples.

**
**
**## Best Fit for Your Trip**
1. **Jiufen** (before/after Taipei days) → cinematic mountain history.
2. **Wulai** (from Taipei) → nature + indigenous culture.
3. **Lukang** (while in Taichung) → historic town, temples.
4. **Alishan** (after Xingang, Chiayi) → iconic blend of misty forests + heritage railway.

**Wulai (乌来)**

* Indigenous Atayal village + waterfalls + hot springs.
* Old timber railway, riverside bathing, and aboriginal food culture.

**Tainan (台南)**

* Taiwan’s oldest city, filled with temples, forts, and Dutch/Japanese colonial history.
* Near wetlands (Sicao Green Tunnel, Chigu Salt Fields), where history of salt trade meets mangrove nature.

Taipei 101 Tuned Mass Damper 
**Songshan Cultural & Creative Park (松山文创园区)** → a former tobacco factory, now Taiwan’s “design hub.” Hosts exhibitions, pop-ups, design shops.
**Huashan 1914 Creative Park (华山1914文创园区)** → similar adaptive reuse space, more artsy, often has indie design, film, or performance events.

**Dihua Street (迪化街)** → 19th-century shophouses, great for seeing Taipei’s layering of history, commerce, and preservation.
**Ximending** → pedestrianized “Shibuya of Taipei.” Good for street culture, neon, youth design.

**Longshan Temple (艋舺龙山寺)** → Taipei’s most famous folk/Buddhist temple. Layers of Taoist, Buddhist, and Confucian symbolism.
**Xingtian Temple (行天宫)** → Guan Yu worship, modern temple layout, no incense — interesting contrast to the older ones.

**Shilin Night Market** → most famous, touristy but a must-see.
**Raohe Night Market** → more compact, with iconic pepper buns at the gate.
**Ningxia Night Market** → smaller, more local, better if you want to focus on specific Taiwanese foods.

**National Palace Museum** → design of artifacts, imperial aesthetics. A bit heavy, but world-class collection.

**Jiufen** → mountain village with red lanterns, said to inspire Spirited Away visuals.
**Shifen** → waterfalls + sky lantern release tradition.
**Beitou Hot Springs** → Japanese-era bathhouses + modern architecture.

**Red House (西门红楼, Ximending)** → Japanese colonial octagonal market, now an indie design shop + LGBTQ hub.
**Taiwan Design Museum (台灣設計館, inside Songshan)** → curated exhibitions on graphic, product, and industrial design.

items.full_text:
# I REALIZE SOME THINGS ARE NOT WORHT FIXING 
Nov 27 2025

Because they will just keep breaking again and you won't feel progress. I need progress. I need growth. I need youthful energy around me. Fresh ideas. Novel ideas. Commitment to a task. Reminder that people can achieve things if they put their hard work into it, despite being ugly, short, unfunny, uncharismatic, etc. 

- Work 3D Printer networking and not succeeding
- Home networking constantly breaking 
- Grandma Computer 

Feeling very low. No energy to go to gym (Ji never tells me she finds my muscles attractive). Feels like nothing has rewards. Dopa chasing and watching reels more lately. Swiping more to find women rather than putting in the time to become someone I would want to date. 

———

Talk with dad was good. Maybe I just need to have more positives conversations to bring me out of the funk.

# I WISH YOU LOVE
Dec 7 2025 
![I WISH YOU LOVE-2](images/I%20WISH%20YOU%20LOVE-2.png)

![I WISH YOU LOVE-3](images/I%20WISH%20YOU%20LOVE-3.png)

**Tuning: **E A D G B E**Capo: no capo**

[Verse 1]
           **Dm7**              **G7**

I wish you bluebirds in the spring
             **Cmaj7**        **Am7**

To give your heart a song to sing
           **Dm7**            **G7**

And then a kiss, but more than this
           **Cmaj7**   **Am7**

I wish you love
 
         **Dm7**    **G7**

And in July a lemonade
            **Cmaj7**         **Am7**

To cool you in some leafy glade
           **Dm7**                   **G7**

I wish you health, and more than wealth
           **Cmaj7**  **Gm7**

I wish you love
 
 
[Chorus]
**C7**          **F**            **Fm7**

My breaking heart and I agree
             **Em7**           **A7**

That you and I could never be
            **Am**            **D7**

So, with my best, my very best
          Dm7  Gaug
I set you free-ee
 
 
[Verse 2]
           Dm7              G7
I wish you shelter from the storm
      Cmaj7             Am7
A cozy fire to keep you warm
            Dm7                 G7
But most of all, when snowflakes fall
        C
I wish you love
 
 
[Intrumental]
Am7 Dm7 G7 Cmaj7 Amaj7 A7 Dm7 G7 Cmaj7
 
Amaj7      Dm7 G7 Cmaj7 A7 Dm7 G7  C7
I wish you love,  love,    love,   love
 
 
[Chorus]
            F            Fm7
My breaking heart and I agree
             Em7           A7
That you and I could never be
            Am            D7
So, with my best, my very best
          Dm7  Gaug
I set you free-ee
 
 
[Verse 3]
           Dm7              G7
I wish you shelter from the storm
      Cmaj7             Am7
A cozy fire to keep you warm
            Dm7                 G7
But most of all, when snowflakes fall
            Em7                 A7
But most of all, when snowflakes fall
           Dm7   G7    Cmaj7
I wish you love, love, love

# BAS Veo Prompt 

static frame video of slow motion of people running in. run club group,, in profile, at a long focal length,camera shouldbe locked down and not move. backgroudn should be black. background should be clearly deliniated from foreground. background should be completey black. generate in the style of a ettiene jules marey multiple exposure chronophotography, ie black and white and high contrast from background. but do not duplicate people. the people should all be running in same direction and at different cadences.
zoom in and on their legs and feet and the contact between that and the ground. focus on the motion and the dynamics of the motion.

items.full_text:
# 7. Agent Belief Graphs

**## 7. Agent Belief Graphs**
* Nodes = beliefs (assertions)
* Edges = evidence, confidence, contradiction
* Versions:
	* Bayesian knowledge graphs
	* Truth-maintenance systems
* Used in agents that need to revise beliefs.

Thoughts on Knowledge Graphs
- How do you know what to make a node?
- Shouldn’t clusters of vectors make their own nodes? Why even have a graph of discrete nodes and edges in this case. 

Realistically, there should be a vector space which contains raw information and then an occasional reindexing of this with a belief graph in which vector space is modeling as a series nodes and edges. Each iteration and or update should increase or decrease strengths of edges or reinforcement of node value / relevance

items.full_text:
# 7. Agent Belief Graphs

**## 7. Agent Belief Graphs**
* Nodes = beliefs (assertions)
* Edges = evidence, confidence, contradiction
* Versions:
	* Bayesian knowledge graphs
	* Truth-maintenance systems
* Used in agents that need to revise beliefs.

Thoughts on Knowledge Graphs
- How do you know what to make a node?
- Shouldn’t clusters of vectors make their own nodes? Why even have a graph of discrete nodes and edges in this case. 

Realistically, there should be a vector space which contains raw information and then an occasional reindexing of this with a belief graph in which vector space is modeling as a series nodes and edges. Each iteration and or update should increase or decrease strengths of edges or reinforcement of node value / relevance

items.full_text:
# I KNOW ENOUGH

- Let There Be Light 

*“God’s logos is such that what God says happens.”*

*“There is no distinction between God’s will, God’s word, and God’s action.”*

*“For God, the distance between thought and reality is zero.”*

**1. Augustine (4th–5th c.)**
Theme: **God’s will is identical to God’s act.**

* Augustine argues that God’s creating is *simultaneous with willing*; no temporal process, no delay.

**2. Thomas Aquinas (13th c.)**
Theme: **Pure Act (actus purus).**

* In God, **essence = existence = will = act**.
* There is no potentiality in God, therefore **no “distance” between will and execution**.

AI Memory 

https://venturebeat.com/ai/gam-takes-aim-at-context-rot-a-dual-agent-memory-architecture-that

## The memorizer: Total recall without overload
The memorizer captures every exchange in full, quietly turning each interaction into a concise memo while preserving the complete, decorated session in a searchable page store. It doesn’t compress aggressively or guess what is important. Instead, it organizes interactions into structured pages, adds metadata for efficient retrieval and generates optional lightweight summaries for quick scanning. Critically, every detail is preserved, and nothing is thrown away.
## The researcher: A deep retrieval engine
When the agent needs to act, the researcher takes the helm to plan a search strategy, combining embeddings with keyword methods like BM25, navigating through page IDs and stitching the pieces together. It conducts layered searches across the page-store, blending vector retrieval, keyword matching and direct lookups. It evaluates findings, identifies gaps and continues searching until it has sufficient evidence to produce a confident answer, much like a human analyst reviewing old notes and primary documents. It iterates, searches, integrates and reflects until it builds a clean, task-specific briefing.
