items.full_text:
# Enshitification Ramble
Dec 11 2025 

Smart devices + software-driven business models mark a **fundamental shift in incentives**: from ownership-based consumption (industrial capitalism) to rent-based access (digital feudalism). This reverses the mid-20th-century expansion of individual independence tied to property ownership.

**## General Principle**
* **Value is extracted from differentials**:
	* Cost vs quality of life.
	* Access vs ownership.
	* Stability vs risk.
* This mirrors physics:
	* Engines run on **energy gradients**, not equilibrium.
	* Economic systems run on **inequality and asymmetry**, not balance.

Orignal Ramble: 

Smart devices are a fundamental change along with software or fundamental change in the incentive structure of industrialized production for consumption so basically if we assume that the great democratization of industrialization or I guess I mean that peaked in the 1950s middle class American dream if we think about that as a result of one government meeting mash populations in wartime on mass to the fruits of industrialization in non-wartime scenarios was about consumption and consumption directly ties with property law does that we own the product that we have and we therefore, as a purchaser and owner of more property become more independent from the system itself if we then think about now how these tech companies are rent seeking entities which are trying to basically create products that we no longer will buy that we will constantly rent or lease then we are basically re-creating the means of feudalism, and which people were disenfranchise from the ownership of the means of production, and the means I don’t know the general means of living I’m not sure what that term would be but yeah, they’re basically dispossessed of those things and I think that is a fundamental shift that we’re going to see play out of the next couple hundred years I know it sounds kind of like catastrophic, but the idea that the natural state of affairs is income inequality, and a large dispossessed under class, which has no ownership of the system itself. I think yeah it was like America and American democracy and America American dream all that sort of a blip on the radar of that and I think that’s the dream that was when we pee that’s when we hit like peak enlightenment I would say but yeah, I think That was supposed to me that the direction of Societies in the age of the computer and the Internet is a return ironically is a return to rent CK low levels of ownership which is which is ironic because the post of post labor economics people talk about ownership being the ultimate solution to the the AI automation post labor dilemma. Firstly, I’m very suspicious of the idea of a post labor dilemma because Every single time industrialized process has revolutionized and put people out of work sign significantly we’ve always seen a bounce back for people will find new jobs and entrepreneurs will find new ways to utilize the low cost of labor because labor falls in value and that just that just opens up new parts of opportunities in addition The the increase of potential changes or increases or I mean, it doesn’t even be an increase. It’s just there’s an arbitrage between quality of life that can be leverage by entrepreneurs and in terms of flavor so I’ll give you an example like today if you think about how so many people are twitch streamers right or some people want aspired of twitch tremors they do on the side And they get paid like maybe a little bit but maybe get paid like that model is only enabled because of the arbitrage of there’s a huge demand for the service and there’s also the ability for those people to live comfortably without making that their full-time career or or yeah I mean basically but life is good enough that you can work a side job and with streamer and have that be a viable combination And if you get any, if you think about it, there is no fundamental reason why we need more you know that there

You’re referring to **Vilém Flusser**, Czech-Brazilian media philosopher. He argued that art is a strategy against **entropy, forgetting, and death**—a human attempt to escape finitude.

Flusser didn’t use the phrase “purpose of art is immortality” as a fixed thesis, but this idea is consistent with his writings. Key points:

# Medium is the message 
The internet is inherently narcissistic 

Coming out to a social event is giving other people your time in a suboptimal way
